wikipedia_page.main: Lieutenant Ewart Alan Mackintosh MC (4 March 1893 – 21 November 1917) was a war poet and an officer in the Seaforth Highlanders from December 1914. Mackintosh was killed whilst observing the second day of the second Battle of Cambrai, 21 November 1917. His best poetry has been said to be comparable in quality to that of Rupert Brooke.

response: * Ewart Alan Mackintosh (posthumous), War, The Liberator, and Other Pieces, Scottish poet

* March 4 – Ewart Alan Mackintosh (killed in action 1917), English war poet of Scottish ancestry
*Ewart Alan Mackintosh MC (1893–1917), war poet and an officer in the Seaforth Highlanders
* Ewart Alan Mackintosh (1893–1917), lieutenant in the British army during the First World War and a war poet
* Ewart Alan Mackintosh's poetry War, The Liberator, and Other Pieces is published posthumously.
* Ewart Alan Mackintosh (who is killed on 23 November in the Battle of Cambrai) publishes A Highland Regiment and Other Poems.
